page.title: 02Summary of the Meir area
page.content: The area did possess a coal mine until 1964,Parkhall Colliery,but this has since been reclaimed and now new housing stands on the site of the former colliery. The total population of the area is about 19000.The majority of people in the area are employed in skilled work or non-manual work.Unemployment for the area stands at about 19% which is above the national average The politics of the area are predominently Labour,the three elected councillors from the area belong to that party. The largest school in the area is Longton High a 11-16 comprehensive which had a school population in 1985 of 1556,it is one of the largest schools in Staffordshire.
